title: Mark Meadows Declines to Appear Before Jan. 6 Committee
sub_head: Trump’s former chief of staff didn’t show up to testify before panel investigating attack on Congress
body:
WASHINGTON—Former Trump administration chief of staff Mark Meadows failed to appear for a Friday deposition before the House select committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol, raising the prospect of a contempt-of-Congress vote and possibly a referral to the Justice Department for criminal charges.
Mr. Meadows, who was chief of staff to then President Donald Trump when the Capitol was attacked earlier this year, had been subpoenaed in September and was asked in October to testify.
